title: Introduction to BasaltCMS
content:
# Introduction to BasaltCMS

## What is BasaltCMS?
BasaltCMS is a high-performance, developer-first Content Management System built on the modern web stack. Unlike traditional monolithic CMS platforms, BasaltCMS leverages the power of **Next.js 15 (App Router)** and **React Server Components** to deliver content with zero client-side JavaScript overhead where possible.

## Key Features

- **Visual Editor**: Real-time content editing with a drag-and-drop interface powered by our custom visual blocks engine.
- **AI Assistant**: Built-in AI tools analyze your text in real-time, offering suggestions to improve clarity, tone, and SEO. This "genius mode" significantly boosts content output quality and velocity.
- **Vendor Compliance (VCMS)**: Manage vendor profiles, compliance documents, and validation with AI-powered checks.
- **Type-Safe Content**: Fully typed schemas using Prisma and TypeScript ensure your content structure is rigid and reliable.
- **Asset Management**: Integrated media library for managing images, videos, and documents.

title: Vendor Compliance (VCMS)
content:
# Vendor Compliance Management System (VCMS)

## Overview
The VCMS module allows organizations to manage vendor relationships, track compliance documentation, and ensure adherence to safety standards. It uses AI to extract and validate vendor data from diverse sources like business cards and invoices.

## Key Concepts

### Vendor Profile
The central record for a vendor, containing contact info, compliance status, and history.
- **Validation Status**: `VALIDATED`, `AMBIGUOUS` (needs review), or `REJECTED`.
- **Compliance Score**: A 0-100 score based on document completeness and history.

### Documents
Vendors can have multiple compliance documents (COI, W9, Licenses).
- **Status**: `VALID`, `MISSING`, `EXPIRED`, `PENDING_REVIEW`.

## AI Scanning
The system includes an "AI Scanner" in the Media Library. Uploading a business card image automatically:
1.  Extracts contact details (Name, Email, Phone, Company).
2.  Performs a background check for basic compliance flags.
3.  Creates a Draft Vendor Profile for review.

title: System Architecture
content:
# System Architecture

## Core Technologies

- **Next.js 15 (App Router)**: The backbone of the application, handling routing, SSR, and API endpoints.
- **Prisma ORM**: Manages database access and schema definitions.
- **Tailwind CSS**: Utility-first styling engine.
- **Shadcn/UI**: Accessible, reusable component primitives.
- **NextAuth.js**: Authentication and session management.

## Directory Structure

```bash
├── app/
│   ├── [locale]/           # Internationalized routes
│   │   ├── cms/            # Protected admin routes
│   │   ├── (public)/       # Public facing pages (Blog, Docs)
│   │   └── api/            # API Route Handlers
├── components/
│   ├── ui/                 # Shadcn primitives
│   ├── demo/               # Premium marketing components
│   └── editor/             # Visual editor blocks
├── lib/
│   ├── prisma.ts           # Database client instance
│   └── vcms/               # Vendor Compliance logic
└── prisma/                 # & Seeds
    └── schema.prisma       # Database models
```

title: Content Management
content:
# Content Management

## The Visual Editor
BasaltCMS introduces a unique "Block-Based" visual editor for creating rich content pages. Unlike a simple WYSIWYG editor, the Block Editor allows you to compose pages using pre-defined React components.

### Available Blocks
- **Hero Section**: Full-width header with title, subtitle, and CTA.
- **Feature Grid**: A responsive grid layout for displaying key information.
- **Rich Text**: Standard markdown-supported text block.
- **Media**: Embed images or videos with options for aspect ratio and lazy loading.
- **Testimonials**: Customer quotes with avatar and attribution.
- **Call to Action**: Conversion-focused sections with buttons.
- **Pricing Tables**: Compare plans and features.

## Landing Pages
The **Landing Pages** module allows you to create full marketing pages using the Puck visual editor.

### Puck Editor
- **Drag & Drop**: Visually arrange components on your page.
- **Live Preview**: See changes in real-time across devices.
- **Templates**: Start from pre-built templates or blank canvas.
- **WordPress Sync**: Push pages directly to your WordPress site.

## Blog Engine
The blog system is designed for high SEO performance. It supports:
- **Tags & Categories**: Organize posts efficiently.
- **Author Profiles**: Link posts to user profiles.
- **AI-Assisted Writing**: Generate and revise content with AI.
- **Cover Images**: AI image generation via Nano Banana.
- **Analytics Integration**: Track clicks, shares, and engagement.
- **Related Articles**: Automatically suggest relevant content.

title: Database Schema (CMS)
content:
# Database Schema (CMS)

## System Models
These core models power the CMS functionality:

### User & Identity
- **`User`**: Admin and editor accounts. Linked to `Account` and `Session` for auth.
- **`Role`**: Defines permissions (e.g., ADMIN, EDITOR, VIEWER).

### Content Models
- **`DocArticle`**: Polymorphic model for Documentation and SOPs.
- **`BlogPost`**: public articles with `slug`, `excerpt`, `coverImage`, and `publishedAt`.
- **`MediaItem`**: Stores metadata for uploaded assets (url, type, size).

### Vendor Models
- **`VendorProfile`**: Core vendor record with scores and contact info.
- **`ComplianceRecord`**: Tracks individual document uploads and expiry dates.

### Configuration
- **`FooterSetting`**: Global footer configuration (tagline, copyright).
- **`FooterSection`**: Configurable column in the footer.
- **`FooterLink`**: Individual links within a section.

title: Authentication
content:
# Authentication

## Setup
Authentication is securely handled by **NextAuth.js**. The configuration is located in `app/api/auth/[...nextauth]/route.ts`.

### Supported Providers
1.  **Email/Password**: Uses `bcrypt` for password hashing.
2.  **OAuth**: Built-in support for Google and GitHub. Configurable via `.env` variables:
    - `GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID`
    - `GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET`

## Protecting Routes

### Proxy (Replacing Middleware)
We use a specialized `proxy.ts` (acting as middleware) to protect the `/cms` dashboard routes. Next.js 15+ middleware changes required this shift to ensure stable session handling.

Any request to `/cms/*` without a valid session token is redirected to `/login`.

```typescript
// proxy.ts
import { auth } from "./auth"
// ... validation logic
```

title: Global Styling & Theming
content:
# Global Styling & Theming

## Tailwind CSS Configuration
The project uses a customized `tailwind.config.ts`. We have extended the default theme to include our brand specific colors (deep slate, neon accents).

### Dark Mode First
BasaltCMS is designed as a dark-mode first experience.
- **Base Background**: `bg-slate-950` (#020617)
- **Glass Effect**: `bg-white/5 backdrop-blur-md`
- **Borders**: `border-white/10`

## Component Library
We use **Shadcn/UI** for base components. You can find them in `components/ui`. They are unstyled by default, allowing for full customization via Tailwind classes.

### Icons
We standardise on **Lucide React** for iconography. Ensure you import icons from `lucide-react` to maintain visual consistency.

title: API Reference
content:
# API Reference

## Internal API Routes
These routes are used by the CMS frontend to interact with the database.

### Articles
- **`GET /api/articles`**: List all articles. Supports pagination and filtering.
- **`POST /api/articles`**: Create a new article (Admin only).
- **`PATCH /api/articles/[id]`**: Update an article.

### Uploads
- **`POST /api/upload`**: Upload a file to the configured storage provider (S3 or local). Returns the public URL.

### Stats
- **`GET /api/stats`**: Returns dashboard analytics (total posts, views, recent activity).

## Rate Limiting
API routes are rate-limited to 100 requests per minute to prevent abuse.

title: Deployment
content:
# Deployment

## Vercel Deployment (Recommended)
The easiest way to deploy BasaltCMS is via Vercel.

1.  **Connect Repo**: Import your Git repository in Vercel.
2.  **Environment Variables**: Add your `.env` variables (DATABASE_URL, NEXTAUTH_SECRET, etc.).
3.  **Build Command**: `next build`
4.  **Install Command**: `npm install`

## Docker Deployment
A `Dockerfile` is included in the root for containerized deployment.

```dockerfile
FROM node:18-alpine
WORKDIR /app
COPY . .
RUN npm install
RUN npm run build
CMD ["npm", "start"]
```

title: Apps & Plugins Architecture
content:
# Apps & Plugins Architecture

## Overview
The Apps system is designed to facilitate **Omnichannel Content Distribution**. It allows the CMS to act as a "Headless" source of truth that pushes content to various downstream platforms (Shopify, WooCommerce, WordPress, etc.).

## Category Tabs
Apps are organized into four categories:
- **E-Commerce**: Shopify, WooCommerce, Stripe integrations.
- **Base Broadcast**: Social media distribution to Farcaster, Lens Protocol, and other decentralized networks.
- **Publishing**: WordPress, Medium, and content syndication platforms.
- **Utility**: Zapier, webhooks, and automation tools.

## Data Schema

### `AppConnection`
Stores the credentials and configuration for a connected third-party app.
```prisma
model AppConnection {
  providerId  String      // e.g. "shopify", "woocommerce"
  category    AppCategory // ECOMMERCE | PUBLISHING | UTILITY
  credentials Json        // Encrypted payload
  config      Json?       // App-specific settings
  isActive    Boolean
}
```

## Security Model

### Encryption at Rest
We use **AES-256-CBC** to encrypt sensitive fields within the `credentials` JSON object before saving to MongoDB. This includes:
- Shopify Access Tokens
- WooCommerce Consumer Secrets
- WordPress Application Passwords
- Social media API keys

The encryption key `API_KEY_ENCRYPTION_KEY` is injected via environment variables and never exposed to the client.

### Audit Logging
Every interaction with the Apps system is logged to `SystemActivity` and `AppSyncLog`.
- **Connection Events**: Logged when a user connects/disconnects an app.
- **Sync Events**: Logged whenever content is pushed to an external provider.

## Adding New Integrations
To add a new integration:
1.  **Frontend**: Add a new card to `apps/page.tsx` and configure the `AppConnectModal`.
2.  **Backend**: Implement the auth flow (OAuth or API Key) in `api/cms/apps/connect`.
3.  **Client**: Create a new client class in `lib/apps/[provider]/client.ts` to handle content transformations.

title: User & Team Management
content:
# User & Team Management

## Role-Based Access Control (RBAC)
BasaltCMS uses a defined set of roles to secure the system.
- **Super Admin (Owner)**: Full access to everything, including security settings and billing. Cannot be deleted.
- **Admin**: Full access to all modules, but cannot delete the Owner.
- **Editor**: Access to Content modules (Blog, Media, Docs) and Activity Log.
- **Viewer**: Read-only access to the Dashboard.

## Module Management

### Fine-grained Access
Admins can now toggle specific CMS modules for individual users, overriding their role defaults. This is useful for giving a "Viewer" access to just one specific tool, like the **Form Builder** or **Blog**.

1. Go to **Team Members**.
2. Click the **Edit** icon on a user.
3. Select the **CMS Modules** tab.
4. Toggle the desired modules on/off.

## Security Features

### Password Management
- **Force Password Reset**: Admins can trigger a password reset for a user. The user will receive an email with instructions.
- **Secure Password Generation**: When creating a user, the system can auto-generate a strong, secure password.

### User Status
Users can be set to `ACTIVE`, `INACTIVE` (temp ban), or `PENDING`.

title: Form Builder
content:
# Form Builder

## Overview
The Form Builder module allows you to create high-converting lead capture forms, surveys, and contact forms without writing code. These forms can be embedded on your Landing Pages or shared via direct link.

## Creating a Form
1. Navigate to **Form Builder** in the sidebar.
2. Click **Create New +**.
3. Choose **AI Assistant** to describe your form, or start from scratch.

### Field Types
- **Text / Email / Phone**: Standard input fields with validation.
- **Select / Checkbox**: Multiple choice options.
- **File Upload**: Allow users to attach documents.

## Integration
Forms automatically capture submissions to the CMS database. You can also connect them to:
- **Email**: Receive notifications on new submissions.
- **CRM**: Sync leads to Salesforce, HubSpot, etc. (via **Apps** module).

title: Universal Voice
content:
# Universal Voice Agent

## Overview
The Universal Voice module enables a conversational AI agent capable of handling voice interactions. This can be used for customer support, sophisticated dictation, or interactive voice response (IVR) flows.

## Beta Status
> [!WARNING]
> This feature is currently in **BETA**. It may require high-bandwidth connections and specific browser permissions (Microphone access).

## Access Control
Due to the experimental nature and potential costs associated with Voice AI (LLM tokens + Text-to-Speech generation), this module is **hidden by default**.

To enable it for a user:
1. Go to **Team Members** > **Edit User**.
2. In **CMS Modules**, toggle **Universal Voice** to ON.
3. The user will now see the microphone icon in their sidebar.

title: Footer & SEO Management
content:
# Footer & SEO Management

## Overview
The Footer & SEO module provides a centralized interface for managing your site's footer content, social media profiles, and global SEO settings. Access it via **Footer & SEO** in the sidebar.

## Tab Navigation
The module is organized into three tabs:

### 1. Footer Content
Configure the visual footer that appears on your public pages.
- **Tagline**: Your brand's tagline or mission statement.
- **Copyright Text**: Legal copyright notice (e.g., "© 2024 Basalt").
- **Footer Logo**: Upload a custom logo for the footer.
- **Sections**: Create unlimited footer columns with custom links.

### 2. Social Profiles
Manage all your social media and contact links in one place:
- **Social Networks**: X/Twitter, Discord, LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook, YouTube, TikTok, GitHub, Telegram, Reddit, Threads, Mastodon.
- **Contact Info**: Support email, sales email, phone number.
- **App Store Links**: iOS App Store and Google Play Store URLs.

### 3. SEO Settings
Control global SEO metadata for your entire site:
- **Global Title**: Default page title for all pages.
- **Global Description**: Meta description for SEO.
- **Open Graph**: OG image, title, and description for social sharing.
- **Twitter Card**: Twitter-specific sharing settings.
- **Favicon**: Upload your site's favicon.

## AI-Assisted SEO
Click the **Sparkles** icon to generate AI-optimized SEO metadata based on your site content.

title: WordPress Integration
content:
# WordPress Integration

## Overview
The WordPress Command Center provides a powerful two-way sync between BasaltCMS and your WordPress site. Import existing content from WordPress or push new content created in the CMS.

## Setup
1. Navigate to **Apps & Plugins** > Connect **WordPress**.
2. Enter your WordPress site URL.
3. Provide your WordPress **Application Password** (Settings > Security > Application Passwords).
4. Click **Connect** to establish the link.

## Command Center Features

### Dashboard Tab
View your WordPress site status at a glance:
- Connection status indicator
- Total posts, pages, and media count
- Last sync timestamp

### Posts Tab
Manage WordPress posts:
- View all posts from your WordPress site
- Import individual posts or bulk import
- See import status indicators

### Pages Tab
Manage WordPress pages:
- Import existing pages into Landing Pages
- Sync CMS Landing Pages to WordPress
- Convert WordPress content to Puck visual blocks

### Media Tab
Sync media assets:
- Import WordPress media library items
- Push CMS media to WordPress
- Track sync status per item

## Import by URL
Quickly import any WordPress page by pasting its URL. The system will:
1. Fetch the page content
2. Convert HTML to Puck visual blocks
3. Create a new Landing Page in the CMS

title: Blog Analytics
content:
# Blog Analytics

## Overview
The Analytics module provides insights into how your blog content is performing. Track user engagement through clicks, shares, and trends over time.

## Accessing Analytics
- **Analytics Dashboard**: Navigate to **Analytics** in the sidebar for the full dashboard.
- **Quick View**: Click the chart icon on any blog post for a quick analytics modal.

## Key Metrics

### Summary Cards
- **Total Clicks**: Number of times blog posts have been clicked.
- **Total Shares**: Number of times content has been shared.
- **Posts with Events**: Count of posts that have engagement data.

### Time Series Chart
Visualize clicks and shares over time with an interactive area chart. Data is aggregated daily to show trends.

### Top Posts
See your best-performing content ranked by total engagement (clicks + shares). Each entry shows:
- Post title
- Individual clicks and shares
- Total engagement score

## Restore Defaults
If analytics data appears incorrect, use the **Restore Defaults** button to reset the dashboard view. This clears any custom filters or date ranges without affecting underlying data.

title: Careers & Jobs Module
content:
# Careers & Jobs Module

## Overview
The Careers module allows you to manage job listings and track applications directly within the CMS. Create compelling job postings with AI assistance and manage the hiring pipeline.

## Creating Job Postings

### Manual Creation
1. Navigate to **Careers** in the sidebar.
2. Click **Create New +**.
3. Fill in the job details:
   - **Title**: Job position name.
   - **Department**: Engineering, Marketing, Sales, etc.
   - **Location**: Office location or "Remote".
   - **Type**: Full-time, Part-time, Contract.
   - **Summary**: Brief job description (shown in listings).
   - **Content**: Full job description (Markdown supported).
   - **Requirements**: Skills and qualifications.
   - **Apply Link**: External application URL.

### AI-Assisted Creation
1. Click the **Sparkles** icon.
2. Describe the role you're hiring for.
3. AI generates a complete job posting draft.
4. Review and edit as needed.

## Cover Images
- Use the **Nano Banana** AI to generate custom cover images.
- Or select from your **Media Library**.

## Applications Tab
View and manage incoming job applications:
- Filter by job posting
- View applicant details
- Track application status

## Publishing
Toggle jobs between **Active** and **Inactive** status to control visibility on your careers page.

title: Landing Pages Builder
content:
# Landing Pages Builder

## Overview
The Landing Pages module enables you to create stunning marketing pages using the **Puck** visual editor—no coding required. Build conversion-optimized pages with drag-and-drop simplicity.

## Getting Started

### Create a New Page
1. Navigate to **Landing Pages** in the sidebar.
2. Click **Create Page**.
3. Choose a template or start with a blank canvas.
4. Enter your page title and slug.

### Using the Visual Editor
The Puck editor provides a live preview while you build:

- **Component Panel** (left): Drag components onto the canvas.
- **Canvas** (center): Visual representation of your page.
- **Properties Panel** (right): Configure selected component settings.

### Available Components
- **Hero**: Large banner with headline, subtext, and CTA buttons.
- **Features**: Grid layouts for product features.
- **Testimonials**: Customer quotes and reviews.
- **Pricing**: Pricing tables with feature comparison.
- **FAQ**: Accordion-style frequently asked questions.
- **Contact Form**: Embedded forms (via Form Builder).
- **Media**: Images, videos, and galleries.
- **Rich Text**: Free-form content blocks.

## Templates
Start faster with pre-designed templates:
- **Product Launch**: Showcase new products.
- **SaaS Landing**: Software demo pages.
- **Event Registration**: Conference and webinar pages.

## WordPress Sync
Push landing pages directly to your WordPress site. See **WordPress Integration** for setup.

title: Subscriptions & Newsletter
content:
# Subscriptions & Newsletter

## Overview
The Subscriptions module helps you manage your customer base and newsletter subscribers. Track clients and send targeted email campaigns.

## Clients Tab
Manage your subscriber and client list:
- **Add Clients**: Manually add subscribers or import from CSV.
- **View Details**: See subscription status, signup date, and engagement history.
- **Segments**: Organize clients into groups for targeted campaigns.
- **Export**: Download subscriber lists for external tools.

## Newsletter Tab
Create and manage email campaigns:

### Creating a Campaign
1. Navigate to **Subscriptions** > **Newsletter**.
2. Click **Create Campaign**.
3. Configure your email:
   - **Subject Line**: Email subject.
   - **Preview Text**: Text shown in email client previews.
   - **Content**: Rich text or HTML email body.
   - **Recipients**: Choose a segment or all subscribers.

### Sending
- **Send Now**: Immediately dispatch to recipients.
- **Schedule**: Set a future date and time.
- **Test Send**: Send a preview to yourself first.

## Integration
Subscription forms can be embedded on any page using the **Form Builder** module. New submissions automatically appear in your Clients list.

title: FAQ Manager
content:
# FAQ Manager

## Overview
The FAQ Manager allows you to create and organize frequently asked questions for your public website. FAQs are displayed in an accordion format and can be embedded in Landing Pages.

## Creating FAQs

### Add New FAQ
1. Navigate to **FAQ Manager** in the sidebar.
2. Click **Create New +**.
3. Fill in the fields:
   - **Question**: The FAQ question.
   - **Answer**: The response (Markdown supported).
   - **Category**: Group related FAQs together.
   - **Order**: Display order within the category.

### AI Assistance
Click the **Sparkles** icon to:
- Generate FAQ suggestions based on your content.
- Expand brief answers into comprehensive responses.
- Rephrase questions for clarity.

## Organization

### Categories
Group FAQs by topic:
- **General**: Common questions about your company.
- **Billing**: Payment and subscription questions.
- **Technical**: Product usage and troubleshooting.
- **Custom**: Create your own categories.

### Ordering
Drag and drop FAQs to reorder within their category. The order controls how they appear on the public FAQ page.

## Embedding
FAQs can be embedded in Landing Pages using the **FAQ Component** in the Puck editor. Select which categories to display.

title: Activity Log & Audit Trail
content:
# Activity Log & Audit Trail

## Overview
The Activity Log provides real-time surveillance of all actions within the CMS. Every create, update, and delete operation is logged with user attribution and timestamps.

## Accessing the Log

### Full Activity Log
Navigate to **Activity Log** in the sidebar for the complete audit trail.

### Live Log Widget
The dashboard displays a **Live Log** widget showing the 3 most recent activities with real-time updates.

## Log Entry Details
Each activity entry contains:
- **User**: Who performed the action (with avatar).
- **Action**: What was done (CREATE, UPDATE, DELETE).
- **Resource**: What was affected (e.g., "BlogPost", "User").
- **Details**: Additional context about the change.
- **Timestamp**: When the action occurred.

## Action Themes
Activities are color-coded for quick scanning:
- **Green**: Create/Add/Upload actions.
- **Blue**: Update/Edit/Modify actions.
- **Red**: Delete/Remove actions.
- **Amber**: Other actions.

## Export
Click the **Download** icon to export the activity log as a CSV file. This is useful for:
- Compliance audits
- Security reviews
- Team activity reports

## Security
The Activity Log cannot be edited or deleted by any user, ensuring a tamper-proof audit trail for compliance requirements.

title: Media Library Advanced Features
content:
# Media Library Advanced Features

## Overview
The Media Library is your central hub for managing all digital assets. Beyond basic uploads, it offers advanced organization, AI features, and integrations.

## Tab Organization
Media is organized into four tabs:

### My Files
Personal uploads visible only to you.
- Private workspace for drafts
- Not shared with team members

### Public Assets
Shared media accessible to all team members.
- Company logos and brand assets
- Stock images for common use
- Team-shared resources

### Page Assets
Media specifically used in Landing Pages.
- Automatically categorized when uploaded via Puck editor
- Easy to find assets associated with specific pages

### WordPress
Media synced from your WordPress site.
- Imported images and videos
- Maintains WordPress metadata

## AI Features

### AI SEO Generation
Automatically generate SEO metadata for images:
1. Select an image.
2. Click the **Sparkles** icon.
3. AI generates:
   - **Alt Text**: Accessible description.
   - **Title**: SEO-friendly title.
   - **Caption**: Display caption.
   - **Description**: Detailed description.

### Vendor Card Scanning
Upload business cards to automatically:
1. Extract contact information.
2. Create a draft Vendor Profile.
3. Link the card image to the vendor.

## File Management
- **Drag & Drop**: Upload multiple files at once.
- **URL Import**: Add images via URL.
- **Mobile Camera**: Capture directly from mobile devices.
- **Metadata Editing**: Update title, alt text, and descriptions.
- **Copy URL**: Quick clipboard copy for sharing.
